content: daydream is a relaxed-fit sweater with simple shaping it also features some of my favorite decorative elements such as the v-style neck detail and garter ridges at the cuffs and hem - little details that can make a basic simple sweater more interesting construction method the sweater body is knit from top to bottom knitting begins with back shoulders worked back and forth to underarms before putting stitches on a holder stitches are then picked up for front shoulders and worked back and forth to underarms where front and back are joined and worked in rounds down to lower hem the sleeves are then picked up directly from the body and after working the caps back and forth are then joined to work in rounds down to the cuffs fit the sweater is best worn with 2-4 inches/5-10 cm of positive ease select a finished circumference that provides this amount of ease finished measurements chest/bust 31 25 35 25 38 5 42 5 48 51 25 57 5 60 64 inches / 79 89 5 97 5 107 5 122 130 146 5 152 5 162 5 cm length 19 5 20 20 25 20 5 20 75 21 21 21 5 21 5 inches / 49 5 51 51 5 52 52 5 53 5 53 5 54 5 54 5 cm yarn knit picks heatherly sport 80% acrylic 20% wool 328yds/300m per 3 5oz/100g hank color atmosphere 4 4 4 4 5 5 5 6 6 hanks yarn characteristics the sample shown uses a sport-weight 4-ply acrylic and wool blend the yarn is smooth and soft a 100% synthetic or 100% wool would be an equally good substitute recommended needle size always use a needle size that gives you the gauge listed - every knitter s gauge is unique us #6/4mm circular needle 32-inch/80cm long or longer us #6/4mm needles for working short circumference in the round us #6/4mm circular needle 16-inch/40cm length for collar us #7/4 5mm circular needle 32-inch/80cm long or longer us #7/4 5mm needles for working short circumference in the round
